1,AC,Access Control,,1.1,AC-1,Access Control Policy and Procedures,"Develop, document, disseminate, review and update access control policy and procedure.",1.1.1,AC-1_[C]_a.1,"Develop, document, and disseminate access control policy.","Develop, document, and disseminate access control policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance"
,,,,,,,,1.1.2,AC-1_[C]_a.2,"Develop, document, and disseminate access control procedure.","Develop, document, and disseminate access control procedure to facilitate the implementation of the access control policy and associated access controls."
,,,,,,,,1.1.3,AC-1_[C]_b.1,Review and update the current access control policy.,Review and update the current access control policy.
,,,,,,,,1.1.4,AC-1_[C]_b.2,Review and update the current access control procedures.,Review and update the current access control procedures.
,,,,1.2,AC-2,Account Management,"Manage/administer system accounts/roles, assign users to accounts and monitor account usage.",1.2.1,AC-2_[C]_a.+,Identify the types of information system accounts needed.,Identifies and selects the types of information system accounts to support organizational missions/business functions
,,,,,,,,1.2.2,AC-2_[C]_b.+,Assign account managers for information system accounts,Assign account managers for information system accounts
,,,,,,,,1.2.3,AC-2_[C]_c.+,Establish conditions for group and role membership,Establish conditions for group and role membership
,,,,,,,,1.2.4,AC-2_[C]_d.+,"Specify authorized users of the information system, group and role membership, and access authorizations for each account","Specify authorized users of the information system, group and role membership, and access authorizations (i.e., privileges) and other attributes (as required) for each account"
,,,,,,,,1.2.5,AC-2_[C]_e.+,Require approvals by for requests to create information system accounts,Require approvals by for requests to create information system accounts following defined procedures/conditions
,,,,,,,,1.2.6,AC-2_[C]_f.+,"Creates, enables, modifies, disables, and removes information system accounts ","Creates, enables, modifies, disables, and removes information system accounts in accordance with organization-defined procedures or conditions"
,,,,,,,,1.2.7,AC-2_[C]_g.+,Monitors the use of information system accounts,Monitors the use of information system accounts
,,,,,,,,1.2.8,AC-2_[C]_h.1,Notify account managers when when accounts are no longer required,Notify account managers when when accounts are no longer required
,,,,,,,,1.2.9,AC-2_[C]_h.2,Notify account managers when when users are terminated or transferred,Notify account managers when when users are terminated or transferred
,,,,,,,,1.2.10,AC-2_[C]_h.3,Notify account managers when when individual information system usage or need-to-know changes,Notify account managers when when individual information system usage or need-to-know changes
,,,,,,,,1.2.11,AC-2_[C]_i.1,Authorize access to the information system based on a valid access authorization,Authorize access to the information system based on a valid access authorization
,,,,,,,,1.2.12,AC-2_[C]_i.2,Authorize access to the information system based on intended system usage,Authorize access to the information system based on intended system usage
,,,,,,,,1.2.13,AC-2_[C]_i.3,Authorize access to the information system based on other attributes,Authorize access to the information system based on other attributes as required by the organization or associated missions/business functions
,,,,,,,,1.2.14,AC-2_[C]_j.+,Review accounts for compliance with account management requirements,Review accounts for compliance with account management requirements at organization-defined frequency
,,,,,,,,1.2.15,AC-2_[C]_k.+,Establish a process for reissuing shared/group account credentials (if deployed) when individuals are removed from the group,Establish a process for reissuing shared/group account credentials (if deployed) when individuals are removed from the group
,,,,1.3,AC-3,Access Enforcement,Enforce approved access authorizations,1.3.1,AC-3_[C]_a.+,Enforce approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources in accordance with applicable access control policies.,The information system enforces approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources in accordance with applicable access control policies.
,,,,1.4,AC-4,Information Flow Enforcement,Enforce approved information flow authorizations,1.4.1,AC-4_[C]_a.+,Enforce approved authorizations for controlling the flow of information within the system and between interconnected systems based on policies,The information system enforces approved authorizations for controlling the flow of information within the system and between interconnected systems based on [Assignment: organization-defined information flow control policies].
,,,,1.5,AC-5,Separation of Duties,Document and implement separation of duties,1.5.1,AC-5_[C]_a.+,Separate organization-defined duties of individuals,Separate organization-defined duties of individuals
,,,,,,,,15.2,AC-5_[C]_b.+,Document separation of duties of individuals,Document separation of duties of individuals
,,,,,,,,1.5.3,AC-5_[C]_c.+,Define information system access authorizations to support separation of duties,Define information system access authorizations to support separation of duties
,,,,1.6,AC-6,Least Privilege,Document and implement the principle of least privilege,1.6.1,AC-6_[C]_a.+,Employ the principle of least privilege allowing only accesses for users which are necessary to accomplish assigned tasks,"Employ the principle of least privilege, allowing only authorized accesses for users (or processes acting on behalf of users) which are necessary to accomplish assigned tasks in accordance with organizational missions and business functions."
,,,,1.7,AC-7,Unsuccessful Logon Attempts,Control/Limit unsuccessful logon attempts,1.7.1,AC-7_[C]_a.+,Enforce a specific limit of consecutive invalid logon attempts by a user during a specific time period,Enforce a specific limit of consecutive invalid logon attempts by a user during a specific time period
,,,,,,,,1.7.2,AC-7_[C]_b.+,Automatically lock the account/node or delay next logon prompt when the maximum number of unsuccessful attempts is exceeded.,Automatically lock the account/node for a defined time period or lock until released by an administrator or delay next logon prompt according to a defined delay algorithm when the maximum number of unsuccessful attempts is exceeded.
,,,,1.8,AC-8,System Use Notification,Display various notifications prior to granting system access,1.8.1,AC-8_[C]_a.1,Display privacy/security notices to users before granting access.,Display notices to users before granting access that they are accessing a private/government/etc. system.
,,,,,,,,1.8.2,AC-8_[C]_a.2,Display monitoring notices to users before granting access.,"Display monitoring notices to users before granting access that usage may be monitored, recorded, and subject to audit"
,,,,,,,,1.8.3,AC-8_[C]_a.3,Display legal/penalty notices to users before granting access.,Display legal/penalty notices to users before granting access that unauthorized use of the information system is prohibited and subject to criminal and civil penalties
,,,,,,,,1.8.4,AC-8_[C]_a.4,Display implied consent notices to users before granting access.,Display implied consent notices to users before granting access to the system requiring consent to monitoring and recording
,,,,,,,,1.8.5,AC-8_[C]_b.+,Retain the notification message or banner on the screen until users acknowledge the usage conditions,Retain the notification message or banner on the screen until users acknowledge the usage conditions and take explicit actions to log on to or further access the information system
,,,,,,,,1.8.6,AC-8_[C]_c.1,Display system use information,Display system use information using organization-defined conditions before granting further access
,,,,,,,,1.8.7,AC-8_[C]_c.2,"Display references, if any to monitoring, recording, or auditing","Display references, if any, to monitoring, recording, or auditing that are consistent with privacy accommodations for such systems that generally prohibit those activities"
,,,,,,,,1.8.8,AC-8_[C]_c.3,Include a description of the authorized uses of the system,Include a description of the authorized uses of the system
,,,,1.9,AC-9,Previous Logon (Access) Notification,"At logon, display the date and time of the last logon (access)",1.9.1,AC-9_[C]_a.+,"Notifiy the user, upon successful logon (access) to the system, of the date and time of the last logon (access).","Notifiy the user, upon successful logon (access) to the system, of the date and time of the last logon (access)."
,,,,1.10,AC-10,Concurrent Session Control,Limit the number of concurrent sessions ,1.10.1,AC-10_[C]_a.+,Limit the number of concurrent sessions to a specific number,Limit the number of concurrent sessions to a specific number for each account/account-type. 
,,,,1.11,AC-11,Session Lock,Lock sessions after specific period of inactivity or upon request,1.11.1,AC-11_[C]_a.+,Initiate a session lock after specific period of inactivity or upon user request,Prevent further access to the system by initiating a session lock after organization-defined time period of inactivity or upon receiving a request from a user
,,,,1.11,,,,1.11.2,AC-11_[C]_b.+,Retain the session lock until the user properly re-authenticates,Retain the session lock until the user reestablishes access using established identification and authentication procedures
,,,,1.12,AC-12,Session Termination,Terminate sessions in specified conditions/situations,1.12.1,AC-12_[C]_a.+,Automatically terminate a user session afterspecific conditions or trigger events,Automatically terminate a user session after organization-defined conditions or trigger events requiring session disconnect
,,,,1.13,AC-13,Supervision & Review - Access Control ,[Withdrawn: Incorporated into AC-2 and AU-6].,1.13.1,AC-13_[C]_a.+,Supervision & Review - Access Control,[Withdrawn: Incorporated into AC-2 and AU-6].
,,,,,AC-14,PERMITTED ACTIONS WITHOUT IDENTIFICATION OR AUTHENTICATION,Identify and document organization-defined user actions that can be performed identification or authentication,1.14.1,AC-14_[C]_a.+,Identify organization-defined user actions that can be performed identification or authentication,Identify organization-defined user actions that can be performed on the information system without identification or authentication consistent with organizational missions/business functions;
,,,,,,,,1.14.2,AC-14_[C]_b.+,Document supporting rationale for user actions not requiring identification or authentication.,"Document and provide supporting rationale in the security plan for the information system, user actions not requiring identification or authentication."
,,,,,AC-15,AUTOMATED MARKING,[Withdrawn: Incorporated into MP-3].,1.15.1,AC-15_[C]_a.+,AUTOMATED MARKING,[Withdrawn: Incorporated into MP-3].
,,,,,AC-16,SECURITY ATTRIBUTES,"Provides the means to associate [Assignment: organization-defined types of security attributes] having [Assignment: organization-defined security attribute values] with information in storage, in process, and/or in transmission;",1.16.1,AC-16_[C]_a.+,Provide the means to associate security attributes having security attribute values with information,"Provide the means to associate organization-defined types of security attributes having organization-defined security attribute values with information in storage, in process, and/or in transmission;"
,,,,,,,,1.16.2,AC-16_[C]_b.+,Ensure that the security attribute associations are made and retained with the information,Ensure that the security attribute associations are made and retained with the information
,,,,,,,,1.16.3,AC-16_[C]_c.+,Establish the permitted organization-defined security attributes for organization-defined information systems,Establish the permitted organization-defined security attributes for organization-defined information systems
,,,,,,,,1.16.4,AC-16_[C]_d.+,Determine the permitted organization-defined values or ranges for each of the established security attributes,Determine the permitted organization-defined values or ranges for each of the established security attributes
,,,,,AC-17,REMOTE ACCESS,"Establish/document/authorize usage restrictions, configuration/connection requirements, and implementation guidance for each type of remote access allowed",1.17.1,AC-17_[C]_a.+,"Document usage restrictions, configuration/connection requirements, and implementation guidance for each type of remote access","Establish and document usage restrictions, configuration/connection requirements, and implementation guidance for each type of remote access allowed"
,,,,,,,,1.17.2,AC-17_[C]_b.+,Authorize remote access to the information system prior to allowing such connections,Authorize remote access to the information system prior to allowing such connections
,,,,,AC-18,WIRELESS ACCESS,"Establish/authorize usage restrictions, configuration/connection requirements, and implementation guidance for wireless access",1.18.1,AC-18_[C]_a.+,"Establish usage restrictions, configuration/connection requirements, and implementation guidance for wireless access","Establish usage restrictions, configuration/connection requirements, and implementation guidance for wireless access"
,,,,,,,,1.18.2,AC-18_[C]_b.+,Authorize wireless access to the information system prior to allowing such connections,Authorize wireless access to the information system prior to allowing such connections
,,,,,AC-19,ACCESS CONTROL FOR MOBILE DEVICES,"Establish/authorize usage restrictions, configuration requirements, connection requirements, and implementation guidance for organization-controlled mobile devices",1.19.1,AC-19_[C]_a.+,"Establish usage restrictions, configuration/connection requirements, and implementation guidance for mobile devices","Establish usage restrictions, configuration requirements, connection requirements, and implementation guidance for organization-controlled mobile devices"
,,,,,,,,1.19.2,AC-19_[C]_b.+,Authorize the connection of mobile devices to organizational information systems,Authorize the connection of mobile devices to organizational information systems
,,,,,AC-20,USE OF EXTERNAL INFORMATION SYSTEMS,Control access to the information system and data from external information systems; and,1.20.1,AC-20_[C]_a.+,The organization establishes terms and conditions allowing authorized individuals to access the information system from external information systems,"The organization establishes terms and conditions, consistent with any trust relationships established with other organizations owning, operating, and/or maintaining external information systems, allowing authorized individuals to Access the information system from external information systems"
,,,,,,,,1.20.2,AC-20_[C]_b.+,"The organization establishes terms and conditions allowing authorized individuals to process, store, or transmit organization-controlled information using external information systems","The organization establishes terms and conditions, consistent with any trust relationships established with other organizations owning, operating, and/or maintaining external information systems, allowing authorized individuals to Process, store, or transmit organization-controlled information using external information systems"
,,,,,AC-21,INFORMATION SHARING,Facilitates information sharing and employ processes to assist users in making information sharing/collaboration decisions,1.21.1,AC-21_[C]_a.+,Facilitate information sharing by enabling authorized users  where user discretion is required,Facilitate information sharing by enabling authorized users to determine whether access authorizations assigned to the sharing partner match the access restrictions on the information for organization-defined information sharing circumstances where user discretion is required
,,,,,,,,1.21.2,AC-21_[C]_b.+,Employ automated or manual processes to assist users in making information sharing/collaboration decisions,Employ organization-defined automated mechanisms or manual processes to assist users in making information sharing/collaboration decisions
,,,,,AC-22,PUBLICLY ACCESSIBLE CONTENT,Designate/train individuals to post information onto publicly accessible systems performing careful reviews to avoid exposing nonpublic information,1.22.1,AC-22_[C]_a.+,Designate individuals authorized to post information onto a publicly accessible information system,Designate individuals authorized to post information onto a publicly accessible information system
,,,,,,,,1.22.2,AC-22_[C]_b.+,Train authorized individuals to ensure that publicly accessible information does not contain nonpublic information,Train authorized individuals to ensure that publicly accessible information does not contain nonpublic information
,,,,,,,,1.22.3,AC-22_[C]_c.+,Review the proposed content of information prior to posting onto the publicly accessible information system to ensure that nonpublic information is not included,Review the proposed content of information prior to posting onto the publicly accessible information system to ensure that nonpublic information is not included
,,,,,,,,1.22.4,AC-22_[C]_d.+,"Review the content on the publicly accessible information system for nonpublic information at an organization-defined frequency and remove such information, if discovered","Review the content on the publicly accessible information system for nonpublic information at an organization-defined frequency and remove such information, if discovered"
,,,,,AC-23,DATA MINING PROTECTION,Employ data mining prevention and detection techniques,1.23.1,AC-23_[C]_a.+,Employ data mining prevention and detection techniques for data storage objects to adequately detect and protect against data mining,Employ organization-defined data mining prevention and detection techniques for organization-defined data storage objects to adequately detect and protect against data mining
,,,,,AC-24,ACCESS CONTROL DECISIONS,Ensure access control decisions are applied to access requests prior to access enforcement,1.24.1,AC-24_[C]_a.+,Establish procedures to ensure access control decisions are applied to each access request prior to access enforcement,Establish procedures to ensure organization-defined access control decisions are applied to each access request prior to access enforcement
,,,,,AC-25,REFERENCE MONITOR,Implement a reference monitor for access control policies,1.25.1,AC-25_[C]_a.+,"Implement a reference monitor for access control policies that is tamperproof, always invoked, and small enough to be subject to analysis and testing, the completeness of which can be assured","Implement a reference monitor for organization-defined access control policies that is tamperproof, always invoked, and small enough to be subject to analysis and testing, the completeness of which can be assured"
2,AT,AWARENESS AND TRAINING,,2.1,AT-1,SECURITY AWARENESS AND TRAINING POLICY AND PROCEDURES,"Develops, documents, and disseminates  security awareness and training policy and procedures",2.1.1,AT-1_[C]_a.1,"Develop, document, and disseminate a security awareness and training policy ","Develop, document, and disseminate a security awareness and training policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance"
,,,,,,,,2.1.2,AT-1_[C]_a.2,"Develop, document, and disseminate procedures to facilitate the implementation of the security awareness and training policy and associated security awareness and training controls","Develop, document, and disseminate procedures to facilitate the implementation of the security awareness and training policy and associated security awareness and training controls"
,,,,,,,,2.1.3,AT-1_[C]_b.1,Reviews and updates the current security awareness and training policyperiodically,Review and update the current security awareness and training policy [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]; and
,,,,,,,,2.1.4,AT-1_[C]_b.2,Review and update the current security awareness and training procedures periodically,Review and update the current security awareness and training procedures [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].
,,,,2.2,AT-2,SECURITY AWARENESS TRAINING,"The organization provides basic security awareness training to information system users (including managers, senior executives, and contractors):",2.2.1,AT-2_[C]_a.+,Provide basic security awareness training as part of initial training for new users;,Provide basic security awareness training as part of initial training for new users;
,,,,,,,,2.2.2,AT-2_[C]_b.+,Provide basic security awareness training when required by information system changes; and,Provide basic security awareness training when required by information system changes; and
,,,,,,,,2.2.3,AT-2_[C]_c.+,Provide basic security awareness training periodically thereafter.,Provide basic security awareness training periodically thereafter.
,,,,2.3,AT-3,ROLE-BASED SECURITY TRAINING,The organization provides role-based security training to personnel with assigned security roles and responsibilities:,2.3.1,AT-3_[C]_a.+,Provide role-based security training to personnel with assigned security roles and responsibilities before authorizing access to the information system or performing assigned duties;,Provide role-based security training to personnel with assigned security roles and responsibilities before authorizing access to the information system or performing assigned duties;
,,,,,,,,2.3.2,AT-3_[C]_b.+,Provide role-based security training to personnel with assigned security roles and responsibilities when required by information system changes; and,Provide role-based security training to personnel with assigned security roles and responsibilities when required by information system changes; and
,,,,,,,,2.3.3,AT-3_[C]_c.+,Provide role-based security training to personnel with assigned security roles and responsibilities periodically thereafter.,Provide role-based security training to personnel with assigned security roles and responsibilitiesperiodically thereafter.
,,,,2.4,AT-4,SECURITY TRAINING RECORDS,"Documents, monitors, and retains individual training records for individual information system security training activities",2.4.1,AT-4_[C]_a.+,"Document, monitor individual information system security training activities","Document, monitor individual information system security training activities including basic security awareness training and specific information system security training"
,,,,,,,,2.4.2,AT-4_[C]_b.+,Retain individual training records for organization-defined time period.,Retains individual training records for organization-defined time period.
,,,,2.5,AT-5,CONTACTS WITH SECURITY GROUPS AND ASSOCIATIONS,[Withdrawn: Incorporated into PM-15].,2.5.1,AT-5_[C]_a.+,CONTACTS WITH SECURITY GROUPS AND ASSOCIATIONS,[Withdrawn: Incorporated into PM-15].
3,AU,AUDIT AND ACCOUNTABILITY,,3.1,AU-1,AUDIT AND ACCOUNTABILITY POLICY AND PROCEDURES,"Develops, documents, and disseminates an audit and accountability policy and implementation procedures.",3.1.1,AU-1_[C]_a.1,"Develop, document, and disseminate an audit and accountability policy ","Develop, document, and disseminate an audit and accountability policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and"
,,,,,,,,3.1.2,AU-1_[C]_a.2,"Develop, document, and disseminate procedures to facilitate the implementation of the audit and accountability policy and associated audit and accountability controls","Develop, document, and disseminate procedures to facilitate the implementation of the audit and accountability policy and associated audit and accountability controls"
,,,,,,,Reviews and updates the current:,3.1.3,AU-1_[C]_b.1,Review and update the current audit and accountability policyperiodically,Review and update the current audit and accountability policy [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]
,,,,,,,,3.1.4,AU-1_[C]_b.2,Review and update the current audit and accountability procedures periodically,Reviews and updates the current audit and accountability procedures [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].
,,,,3.2,AU-2,AUDIT EVENTS,"Determines that the information system is capable of auditing the specified events, coordinates the security audit function with other organizational entities, provides a rationale  to support after-the-fact investigations of security incidents and determines auditible events and their frequencies. ",3.2.1,AU-2_[C]_a.+,Determine that the information system is capable of auditing organization-defined auditable events,Determine that the information system is capable of auditing the following events: [Assignment: organization-defined auditable events]
,,,,,,,,3.2.2,AU-2_[C]_b.+,Coordinate the security audit function with other organizational entities ,Coordinate the security audit function with other organizational entities requiring audit-related information to enhance mutual support and to help guide the selection of auditable events
,,,,,,,,3.2.3,AU-2_[C]_c.+,Provide a rationale for why the auditable events are deemed to be adequate to support after-the-fact investigations of security incidents,Provide a rationale for why the auditable events are deemed to be adequate to support after-the-fact investigations of security incidents
,,,,,,,,3.2.4,AU-2_[C]_d.+,Determine the events to be audited within the information system,Determine that the following events are to be audited within the information system: [Assignment: organization-defined audited events (the subset of the auditable events defined in AU-2 a.) along with the frequency of (or situation requiring) auditing for each identified event].
,,,,3.3,AU-3,CONTENT OF AUDIT RECORDS,The information system generates audit records containing specific information about an event,3.3.1,AU-3_[C]_a.+,Generate audit records containing specfied information,"Generate audit records containing information that establishes what type of event occurred, when the event occurred, where the event occurred, the source of the event, the outcome of the event, and the identity of any individuals or subjects associated with the event."
,,,,3.4,AU-4,AUDIT STORAGE CAPACITY,The organization allocates audit record storage capacity in accordance with [Assignment: organization-defined audit record storage requirements].,3.4.1,AU-4_[C]_a.+,Allocate audit record storage capacity in accordance with audit record storage requirements,Allocate audit record storage capacity in accordance with [Assignment: organization-defined audit record storage requirements].
,,,,3.5,AU-5,RESPONSE TO AUDIT PROCESSING FAILURES,Alerts organization-defined personnel or roles in the event of an audit processing failure,3.5.1,AU-5_[C]_a.+,Alert organization-defined personnel or roles in the event of an audit processing failure,Alert [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles] in the event of an audit processing failure; and
,,,,,,,,3.5.2,AU-5_[C]_b.+,"Take organization-defined actions to shut down information system, overwrite oldest audit records, stop generating audit records","Take the following additional actions: [Assignment: organization-defined actions to be taken (e.g., shut down information system, overwrite oldest audit records, stop generating audit records)]."
,,,,3.6,AU-6,"AUDIT REVIEW, ANALYSIS, AND REPORTING",Reviews and analyzes information system audit records and Reports findings,3.6.1,AU-6_[C]_a.+,Review and analyze information system audit records for indications of  inappropriate or unusual activity,Review and analyze information system audit records [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] for indications of [Assignment: organization-defined inappropriate or unusual activity]; and
,,,,,,,,3.6.2,AU-6_[C]_b.+,Report findings to organization-defined personnel or roles,Report findings to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles].
,,,,3.7,AU-7,AUDIT REDUCTION AND REPORT GENERATION,The information system provides an audit reduction and report generation capability,3.7.1,AU-7_[C]_a.+,"Provide an audit reduction and report generation capability that supports on-demand audit review, analysis, and reporting requirements and after-the-fact investigations of security incident","Provide an audit reduction and report generation capability that supports on-demand audit review, analysis, and reporting requirements and after-the-fact investigations of security incidents; and"
,,,,,,,,3.7.2,AU-7_[C]_b.+,Provide an audit reduction and report generation capability that does not alter the original content or time ordering of audit records.,Provide an audit reduction and report generation capability that does not alter the original content or time ordering of audit records.
,,,,3.8,AU-8,TIME STAMPS,Uses internal system clocks to generate time stamps for audit records and Records time stamps for audit records,3.8.1,AU-8_[C]_a.+,Use internal system clocks to generate time stamps for audit records,Use internal system clocks to generate time stamps for audit records
,,,,,,,,3.8.2,AU-8_[C]_b.+,Record time stamps for audit records,Record time stamps for audit records that can be mapped to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) or Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) and meets [Assignment: organization-defined granularity of time measurement].
,,,,3.9,AU-9,PROTECTION OF AUDIT INFORMATION,"The information system protects audit information and audit tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.",3.9.1,AU-9_[C]_a.+,"Protect audit information and audit tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion","Protect audit information and audit tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion."
,,,,3.10,AU-10,NON-REPUDIATION,The information system protects against an individual (or process acting on behalf of an individual) falsely denying having performed [Assignment: organization-defined actions to be covered by non-repudiation].,3.10.1,AU-10_[C]_a.+,Protect against an individual falsely denying having performed organization-defined actions to be covered by non-repudiation,Protect against an individual (or process acting on behalf of an individual) falsely denying having performed [Assignment: organization-defined actions to be covered by non-repudiation].
,,,,3.11,AU-11,AUDIT RECORD RETENTION,The organization retains audit records for [Assignment: organization-defined time period consistent with records retention policy] to provide support for after-the-fact investigations of security incidents and to meet regulatory and organizational information retention requirements.,3.11.1,AU-11_[C]_a.+,Retain audit records for to provide support for after-the-fact investigations of security incidents and to meet regulatory and organizational information retention requirements.,Retain audit records for [Assignment: organization-defined time period consistent with records retention policy] to provide support for after-the-fact investigations of security incidents and to meet regulatory and organizational information retention requirements.
,,,,3.12,AU-12,AUDIT GENERATION,Provides audit record generation capability for the auditable events defined in AU-2 a,3.12.1,AU-12_[C]_a.+,Provide audit record generation capability for the auditable events defined in AU-2 a.,Provide audit record generation capability for the auditable events defined in AU-2 a. at [Assignment: organization-defined information system components];
,,,,,,,,3.12.2,AU-12_[C]_b.+,Allow organization-defined personnel to select which auditable events are to be audited by specific components of the information system,Allow [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles] to select which auditable events are to be audited by specific components of the information system; and
,,,,,,,,3.12.3,AU-12_[C]_c.+,Generate audit records for the events defined in AU-2 d. with the content defined in AU-3.,Generate audit records for the events defined in AU-2 d. with the content defined in AU-3.
,,,,3.13,AU-13,MONITORING FOR INFORMATION DISCLOSURE,The organization monitors [Assignment: organization-defined open source information and/or information sites] [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] for evidence of unauthorized disclosure of organizational information.,3.13.1,AU-13_[C]_a.+,Monitor open source information periodically for evidence of unauthorized disclosure of information.,Monitor [Assignment: organization-defined open source information and/or information sites] [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] for evidence of unauthorized disclosure of organizational information.
,,,,3.14,AU-14,SESSION AUDIT,The information system provides the capability for authorized users to select a user session to capture/record or view/hear.,3.14.1,AU-14_[C]_a.+,Provide the capability for authorized users to select a user session to capture/record or view/hear.,The information system provides the capability for authorized users to select a user session to capture/record or view/hear.
,,,,3.15,AU-15,ALTERNATE AUDIT CAPABILITY,The organization provides an alternate audit capability in the event of a failure in primary audit capability that provides [Assignment: organization-defined alternate audit functionality].,3.15.1,AU-15_[C]_a.+,Provide an alternate audit capability in the event of a failure in primary audit capability ,Provide an alternate audit capability in the event of a failure in primary audit capability that provides [Assignment: organization-defined alternate audit functionality].
,,,,3.16,AU-16,CROSS-ORGANIZATIONAL AUDITING,The organization employs [Assignment: organization-defined methods] for coordinating [Assignment: organization-defined audit information] among external organizations when audit information is transmitted across organizational boundaries.,3.16.1,AU-16_[C]_a.+,Employ organization-defined methods for coordinating audit information among external organizations,Employ [Assignment: organization-defined methods] for coordinating [Assignment: organization-defined audit information] among external organizations when audit information is transmitted across organizational boundaries.
4,CA,SECURITY ASSESSMENT AND AUTHORIZATION,,4.1,CA-1,SECURITY ASSESSMENT AND AUTHORIZATION POLICY AND PROCEDURES,"Develops, documents, and disseminates a security assessment and authorization policy and procedures to facilitate the implementation of the security assessment and authorization policy ",4.1.1,CA-1_[C]_a.1,"Develop, document, and disseminate a security assessment and authorization policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and","Develop, document, and disseminate a security assessment and authorization policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and"
,,,,,,,,4.1.2,CA-1_[C]_a.2,"Develop, document, and disseminate procedures to facilitate the implementation of the security assessment and authorization policy and associated security assessment and authorization controls; and","Develop, document, and disseminate procedures to facilitate the implementation of the security assessment and authorization policy and associated security assessment and authorization controls; and"
